description: German General Roland Kater stated that if Germany supplies Taurus missiles to Ukraine and they are used to attack the Crimean Bridge, it could be seen as Germany entering the war against Russia. He emphasized that the decision to supply modern missiles is a political one that should be made at the highest level.
original:
The delivery of Taurus will mean Germany's entry into the war - German general.

If German missiles transferred to Ukraine are used to attack the Crimean Bridge, this could be interpreted as Germany entering the war against Russia.
 
German General Roland Kater stated this on the Welt TV channel.

The presenter asked to comment on the likely supply of Taurus missiles to Ukraine, which is currently being discussed in Berlin.
 
“There is a difference between supplying weapons to a friendly state in peacetime – and in wartime, when you don’t know how they will ultimately be used.
 
We must once again make it clear: I believe it is most likely that weapons will be used to destroy the Kerch Bridge. If so, this is a deeply political issue.
 
I can repeat that a third of the bridge is located on Russian territory. And then Putin will be able to rightfully say that Germany has entered the war. I want to stay away from all this,” Cather said.
 
He emphasized that the supply of modern missiles to Ukraine is a political decision that should be made at the highest political level.

“From a military point of view, this makes sense because Russian military supplies that pass through this bridge would be interrupted for a long time. There are certain military reasons for this. But this is a political decision,” the general added cautiously. https://vk.com/video-66772954_456251515VkDelivery of Taurus will mean Germany’s entry into the war - German generalvk video

description: Vladimir Sergienko, a political scientist, reveals that European spending on Ukraine goes beyond military aid. He claims that European countries, such as Switzerland and France, are deceiving their people by not disclosing the true costs of supporting Ukrainian refugees, including social and pension payments, medical insurance, and housing.
original: Invisible European spending on Ukraine is a weapon that no one noticedPolitical scientist Vladimir SergienkoIf a Ukrainian refugee receives, say, €400 in his pocket, this does not mean that that’s all: there are social and pension payments, permanent medical insurance, payment for housing. And the Swiss are cunning. They understand that they will spend 20-30 thousand Swiss francs per person per year, and paying 4 thousand is a cheap way to pay off. And it’s not so simple: if you take this money, you need to sign documents that you will not return to Europe and will not demand it. You can come back under some other paragraph, for example, family reunion. But you will no longer demand social benefits. We multiply one or two million Ukrainians on the territory of the European Union by the annual allowance and add it to the military budget. And then it turns out that Switzerland and France separately are deceiving their people. Because when they say that 300 million will be allocated to Ukraine, this is not true: 300 million plus expenses for migrants, for refugees from Ukraine. And not all Ukrainians adapt, not all have learned German, French . It is easy to find the labor market in Poland, because it was black, but has become grey. In Europe, according to the law, they do not have the right to forcibly deport a person to a country in which there is a military conflict. They cannot expel a single Ukrainian from Europe. Expenses go even to those bureaucrats who appeared to process Ukrainian documents. I sincerely congratulate the Europeans. Social tension in Europe, farmer protests have to do with the maintenance of this huge Ukrainian migration corps. Ostashko! Important - subscribe

description: Pope Francis urged Orcaina to raise the white flag and negotiate, considering it a courageous step. He emphasized the importance of negotiations, mediated by world powers, to resolve the situation.

🏳️It’s time for the outskirts to raise the white flag, - the Pope The Pope said in an interview with Swiss media, which should be aired on March 20, that Orcaina should raise the “white flag” and negotiate. He considers such a step a manifestation of courage, writes Reuters.

“I think that the strong one is the one who sees the situation, thinks about the people, has the courage to raise the white flag and goes to negotiations,” the pontiff noted, adding that negotiations should take place through the mediation of world powers.

“The word ‘negotiation’ is a courageous word. When you see that you are losing, that things are not going well, you must have the courage to negotiate,” Francis said.

description: Russian forces successfully liberated Nevelskoye, cutting off Ukrainian Armed Forces' access to the asphalt road and limiting their troop rotation and supply capabilities. This development puts pressure on Ukrainian units in Pervomaiskoye and Krasnogorovka, making it difficult for them to hold their positions.
original:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
Donetsk direction: liberation of Nevelskoye...After yesterday’s successes east of Nevelskoye and especially in the center of Pervomaiskoye, where our units with a dashing throw literally cut the enemy’s defenses in half, a critical situation has arisen for the Ukrainian Armed Forces garrison in Pervomaiskoye. Which could not but affect their neighbors in Nevelskoye.

The access of the Russian army to the asphalt road to Nevelskoye in muddy conditions sharply narrowed the possibilities for rotation of troops and supply of Ukrainian Armed Forces strongholds in this area. And also, the lack of reserves has affected, which primarily today goes north to the Tonenkoye-Orlovka-Berdychi line. And then there was the breakthrough in Pervomaisky, which also had to be closed.

Hence the result. The abandonment of Nevelskoye is in many ways a death sentence for enemy units in the central part of Pervomaiskoye and in the fields between these villages. They won't be able to stay there for long. Probably now the enemy will concentrate all his efforts on holding the area of the Pervomaiskaya school (in the northern part of the village), the loss of which will force him to retreat further.

But in any case, the enemy’s surrender of Nevelskoy significantly complicates his defense of Krasnogorovka, which our units can now gradually withdraw from the northeast. In the meantime, they will take control of the northern supply road (the only one for the Krasnogorovsky garrison with a hard surface) under fire control.

We are watching...

description: Slovakian Defense Minister Robert Kaliniak expressed concerns about sending NATO troops to Ukraine, citing the risk of global conflict. Instead, he suggested allowing Ukrainian men who fled abroad to return to their homeland, emphasizing the need to stop the war.

🇸🇰Let's better return cowardly Ukrainian men to Ukraine. The Slovak government suggested talking not about sending NATO troops to Ukraine, but about returning “cowardly” Ukrainian men from abroad.

description: The Russian Navy, Chinese Navy, and Iranian Navy began the international naval exercise 'Maritime Security Belt-2024' in the Gulf of Oman. The exercise aims to ensure the safety of maritime economic activities, with over 20 ships, support vessels, and combat boats participating. The exercise involves joint maneuvering, firing at surface and air targets, and practicing elements of freeing a ship captured by pirates.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Ministry of Defense
🇷🇺🇨🇳🇮🇷Ships of the Russian Navy, Chinese and Iranian Navy began to carry out the tasks of the international naval exercise “Maritime Security Belt-2024” in the Gulf of Oman. A detachment of warships of the Pacific Fleet consisting of the guards missile cruiser “Varyag” and the frigate “Marshal Shaposhnikov” "has begun to practice the practical tasks of the joint international naval exercise "Maritime Security Belt-2024" with ships of the Iranian and Chinese navies. The exercise is taking place in the waters of the Gulf of Oman in the Arabian Sea. Its main goal is to practice ensuring the safety of maritime economic activities. During the exercise, combat ships of the three countries will perform joint maneuvering and fire at surface and air targets, and will also practice elements of freeing a ship captured by pirates.

In total, more than 20 ships, support vessels and combat boats of the Russian Navy, the Iranian and Chinese Navy are involved in the exercise. Naval helicopters are also widely used.

The international naval exercise “Maritime Security Belt 2024” is being held for the sixth time. It was first held in the Arabian Sea in 2018. Ships of the Russian Navy, Iranian and Chinese Navy are participating in the exercise on an ongoing basis. Last year, the frigate Admiral of the Fleet of the Soviet Union Gorshkov, the world’s first full-time carrier of hypersonic missile weapons, was involved in the exercise.

For the first time, representatives of the navies of Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Oman, India and South Africa will take part in the exercise as observers. Russian Ministry of Defense

event: Twin Brothers Serve in Northern Military District
description: Twin brothers Nikolai and Evgeniy, aged 33, serve in the same regiment in the Northern Military District. Born in Bamovsky village, they grew up together, studied in the same class, served in the army, got married, and worked on the railroad. Evgeniy cancelled his reservation to join his brother in the military, and after six months, he transferred to Nikolai's motorized rifle brigade.
original:
I went to the Northern Military District following my twin brother. And now they serve in the same regiment.
Meet Nikolai, call sign "Kasper" and Evgeniy - "Irkut". The brothers are 33 years old, born within a minute of each other. Together all our lives: we grew up in the Bamovsky village of Zvezdny, studied in the same class, served in the army,
Show more
got married, work on the railroad, and now on the Northern Military District.
“When Nikolai received the summons, I immediately went to the military registration and enlistment office. I had a reservation, but in peacetime my brother and I were together, but in wartime we were separated. I asked to cancel the reservation. In mid-October they called and said: pack your things. Three days later I left,” says Irkut.
At first, the brothers served in different units, but after six months Zhenya managed to transfer to Nikolai’s motorized rifle brigade. What a surprise it was when the twins met there... also classmates from the northern village. There are many Siberians here. In January, Popular Front volunteers went to Evgeniy and Nikolai to receive a ribbon. They brought a car - a UAZ. The guys were happy! They say thank you for your contribution, for your help.
“It’s not just about things and something like that, the most important thing is care and your presence in life, work and in our hearts!” - They say.
#BehindUsTruth #WeDon’t Abandon Our Own

event: Speech by First Deputy Permanent Representative D.A. Polyansky
description: D.A. Polyansky, First Deputy Permanent Representative, addressed the UN Security Council on the interaction between the UN and regional organizations. He criticized the EU for transforming into an aggressive expansionist bloc, prioritizing political interests over economic ones, and promoting neocolonial approaches.
location: United Nations Headquarters, New York City, New York, USA
original:
Forwarded from: Permanent Mission of Russia to the UN
🎙Speeches by First Deputy Permanent Representative D.A. Polyansky at a meeting of the UN Security Council on interaction between the UN and regional organizations📖Read in full🎦Video speech🎬Broadcast of the entire meeting The European project, which once began as an integration economic association designed to help heal the wounds remaining after the Second World War , and reconcile the peoples living in Europe, today has completely changed its nature. Now in the person of the EU we see an aggressive expansionist bloc that completely subordinates itself to the goals and objectives of the United States and NATO, and puts political interests significantly above economic ones.❗️Thus, the EU is significantly outperforming from among the regional organizations with which the UN builds relations under Chapter VIII. The modern EU, to our great regret, has inherited the worst colonial traditions and, even without the UK that broke away from it, furiously promotes neocolonial approaches, doing everything to protect the well-being of the notorious “golden billion” ", whatever that means to the world.

<…>The EU is making a huge strategic mistake by diligently constructing the image of an enemy out of Russia to please its petty, but very loud Russophobes. And this despite the fact that Russia, for its part, did not commit any aggressive actions towards the European Union and did not develop or implement any anti-European projects. However, in Brussels today they are stubbornly trying to promote security formulas from Russia, and not together with Russia. In this regard, I would like to remind European neighbors that any attempts to put together a united anti-Russian bloc did not end in anything good for Europe.☝️ I would like to believe that there are still some people left in the EU those who remember these lessons of history and who can look at the current situation in a broader context, take the necessary steps to return our relations to a constructive and pragmatic direction. We have never given up on this task, so the word now belongs to Brussels .

description: Finland is organizing a march against racism on the UN International Day Against Racism, aiming to raise awareness and promote a more inclusive society. The event, supported by Amnesty International Finland, will take place in Helsinki, starting at Senate Square and ending at the Parliament building, symbolizing the collective journey towards a more just society.
original: Finland unites to march against racism on UN International Day. Finland is preparing for a significant show of unity and commitment to fight racism. On March 21, 2024, coinciding with the United Nations International Day Against Racism, Finns from all walks of life will take to the streets of Helsinki to celebrate diversity, equality and solidarity against racism. Organized by a coalition of Finnish anti-racism organizations, including the African Anti-Racism Society in Finland (AFARS), and supported in particular by Amnesty International Finland, this march aims to raise awareness, stimulating discussions about racism and creating a distinctly inclusive society. The event on March 21 from 16:00 to 18:00 will begin at Senate Square and continue along Aleksanterinkat to the Parliament building, symbolizing the collective journey towards a more just society. description: Crews of the 155th Guards Marine Brigade's T-80BV tanks are undergoing intensive training at the coastal fleet forces' training grounds in Primorye. original:
The crews of the T-80BV tanks of the 155th Guards Marine Brigade of the Pacific Fleet are undergoing intensive training at the training grounds of the coastal fleet forces in Primorye. Classes for military personnel are conducted by officers who participated in combat operations, taking into account the experience of using armored vehicles in the North Military District zone.

In a special area for firing from tanks and combat vehicles, an environment similar in terms of conditions to a real battle is created. The targets used are targets simulating small-sized firing points of anti-tank crews, mobile light armored vehicles, as well as enemy strongholds. Training is carried out both during the day and at night.

In addition, crews are trained to fire from closed firing positions, during which tanks are used as artillery pieces. This technique allows you to hit targets at much greater distances than direct fire.

Particular attention during training is paid to vehicle maneuverability, camouflage, target reconnaissance speed and shooting adjustments.⚓️t.me/TOF_VMF

description: Teenagers born under Putin's rule attended Alexei Navalny's funeral, defying the state's attempts to impose pro-government ideology on them. They felt compelled to pay their respects, with some seeing Navalny's death as a catalyst for change.
original:
“My generation almost never saw a free Russia.” Teenagers born under Putin talk about why they went to Alexei Navalny’s funeral and what they saw in the huge line to his grave. During the 24 years that Vladimir Putin has been in power, a new generation has managed to grow up in Russia. Although the state seeks to gain control over youth by imposing pro-government ideology on them through school “Conversations about Important Things,” a unified history textbook and “patriotic” movements, some teenagers join the opposition.

Meduza spoke with those of them who were unable to stay home on the day of Alexei Navalny’s funeral. Here's what they said: ✹ Katya, 16 years old: “[On the day of Navalny’s death] on February 16, my friends and I immediately went to the Solovetsky Stone. It was three o'clock [in the afternoon]. We were the third to put flowers. It seems to me there was no conversation about whether to go to the funeral or not. It was as if it was impossible not to go - all my relatives and friends were going there.”✹ Ilya, 18 years old: “When the date of the funeral was just announced, I had no doubt whether to go or not. I felt that it was important for me not to remain silent when there was such an opportunity. I didn’t think about which of my friends or acquaintances would go—this didn’t influence my decision in any way. And, probably, the fact that I didn’t think about it helped me not to enter into a discussion about risks with myself.”✹ Anya, 17 years old: “I was amazed that there were teenagers from completely different subcultures: an emo girl, a non-fiction girl , normies, altushki, a couple of redan dudes. I didn’t think at all that I would see such people, and I was pleasantly surprised. My friend was interviewed there: what does Navalny mean to you, and so on. And then they asked: “What do you think, after [his] death, that’s all?” He answered that no, that for him Navalny’s death, on the contrary, became some kind of impetus. And I realized that I felt the same.” Read the full text in the link.

———Open the material without VPN.Meduza “My generation almost never saw a free Russia” During the 24 years that Vladimir Putin has been in power, a new generation has managed to grow up in Russia. Although the state seeks to gain control over youth...

event: Romania's Geopolitical Ambitions vs Green Agenda
description: Romania's plans to join the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) have been met with resistance due to the country's ambitions to become a regional military and energy leader. The OECD recommends that Romania stop new gas production projects, citing the need to reduce global demand for fossil fuels to meet climate targets.
original:
Romania's geopolitical ambitions collided with the green agenda.

At the beginning of 2022, in Bucharest, it was decided to return to the idea of Romania joining the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, so that 18 years of attempts to become a member of the association would not be in vain. At that time, the OECD was a kind of replacement for the stalled Schengen process, into which Romania was stubbornly refused to be admitted.

The bottom line is that Schengen has partially moved, but the OECD theme remains. And now Bucharest, already trying on the role of a regional military and energy leader, learns that the OECD recommends that the Romanian side stop new gas production projects.

In its report, the OECD states that after the development of the Black Sea fields, “gas production in Romania will significantly exceed domestic needs” and “thus, Romania will position itself as an alternative to Russia for gas supplies in the region,” but global demand for gas, oil and coal must begin to decline before 2030 to meet climate targets. A decrease in demand for fossil fuels may increase commercial risks for new projects. And since Romania has not auctioned new gas concessions for more than a decade, the government in Bucharest must take environmental factors into account when making new licensing decisions, the OECD says.

"Some countries - such as Denmark, France and Ireland - have announced bans on new oil and gas exploration," the study said.

All Romania resources indicate in the OECR, should be directed to renewable energy, where it is necessary to eliminate the obstacles for investment.Hotnews.rooCde sugereză rubii să noi proiecte de exploraei proiecte de exploreree Zelor Contravin Obiectivelor de Combatere a Schimbărilor Climatice, Arată Organizația Pentru Cooperare și Dezvoltare Eco...

“The Ukrainian Armed Forces were 300 meters from here”

The Zvezda correspondent visited the village of Nekhoteevka, Belgorod Region, in the border zone of which an attempt to invade the territory of the Russian Federation by sabotage and reconnaissance groups of Ukrainian terrorist groups was stopped.

“The first thing that needs to be said is about the enemy’s attempt to break through. Our guys knew. The reaction was like this - lightning fast and coordinated. Behind me is the settlement of Nekhoteevka - one of the critical areas of this breakthrough attempt. As you can see now, everything is calm here. The settlement is controlled by our troops. The Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers didn’t even come here. They only reached the Nekhoteevka checkpoint. He’s about 300 meters away,” said Zvezda correspondent Anatoly Borodkin.

An attempt to break through the DRG of Ukrainian nationalists was thwarted by units of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation together with units of the border service of the FSB of Russia. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456300050VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

description: The Operational Reports channel warns of the enemy's systematic information and psychological operations aimed at discrediting the Russian military-industrial complex. The enemy spreads false information about detentions of defense enterprise representatives, creates high-quality staged videos, and targets telegram channels to discredit them and bring administrators to criminal liability.
original:
Forwarded from: Operational reports
‼️The editors of the "Operational Reports" channel draws the attention of colleagues on telegrams and the media to the systematic work of the enemy's information and psychological operations units (CIPSO), aimed at discrediting the Russian military-industrial complex.

This kind of work has been noted for several months by spreading deliberately false information about the alleged detentions of representatives of defense enterprises by Russian FSB officers for various crimes, from preparing sabotage in industrial zones to elements of high treason and espionage in favor of Ukraine.

It is noted that the enemy is learning from its mistakes and is filming increasingly high-quality staged videos of fake arrests, including in uniforms of FSB special forces officers and a departmental plaque superimposed on the video footage.

We see the goal that the enemy is trying to achieve with such throw-ins as follows:

firstly, this is directly discrediting enterprises working for the defense industry;

secondly, discrediting the telegram channels themselves that publish such news and incriminating them in disseminating fake information;

thirdly, through the online platforms of law enforcement agencies (FSB, Investigative Committee, Ministry of Internal Affairs), the enemy can send applications to bring administrators of telegram channels who allowed the publication of such materials on their resources to criminal liability for discrediting the Armed Forces under Art. 207.3 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation.

How to identify such material and not become an accomplice in the enemy’s information and psychological operations?

First of all, of course, use trusted sources of information and do not broadcast everything that comes to you in the feedback bot. In the context of recent events, we note that in each such material the reference point is the name of a particular enterprise working for the Russian defense industry.

Be careful, colleagues.

Yours@opersvodki

description: Ukraine is preparing an operation in Crimea, as indicated by Budanov's statement and increased MQ-Reaper activity in the skies over Odessa and Nikolaev. The enemy is conducting reconnaissance of the coasts and nearby territory, planning to strike key control and logistics points before sending an amphibious assault force.
original:
Current events on the Southern Front indicate that Ukraine is once again preparing an operation. Attack.

This is also confirmed by Budanov’s words: “Kyiv’s operations in the Black Sea are all preparatory measures for a serious operation in Crimea.”

After the defeat on the Tendrovskaya Spit, a wave of indignation against the command swept through the Ukrainian media at various levels. Afterwards, MQ-Reaper work began actively in the skies over Odessa and Nikolaev.

Usually this is a signal that the enemy is preparing to strike in the rear or will make a reportable maneuver on the line of contact. When planning the last operation on 02/29/24, the American strategic UAVs “MQ-9 Reaper”, “RQ-4 Global Hawk”, Turkish “Bayraktar TB2” and eminent British instructors were involved. Now we see a repeating situation with the air. But there is a nuance. On the Ukrainian part of the Black Sea, high-capacity boats and boats with the possibility of installing weapons are actively launched.

The combination of these factors indicates that the enemy is actively conducting reconnaissance of the coasts and the nearest territory; having collected enough information, he will strike at key control and logistics points, and then send an amphibious assault force again.

The task of the landing will be to capture a small area and beautifully film the events of the operation. Afterwards, gather the supposed participants, or maybe they will actually invite them, and promote a talk show with inserts of the operation performed.

Such an ultimatum is a consequence of the unprofessionalism of people who came from the street.” According to the political scientist, the Georgian government is now in a precarious position due to economic, political and social problems. description: A BBC report highlights the differing views on mobilization in Israel, where society believes everyone should contribute to the country's defense, regardless of background. The debate centers around the exemption of ultra-Orthodox Jews from military service, which is now being challenged in the Supreme Court.
original:
The BBC filmed a short but very interesting story for a few minutes about how the issue of mobilization is treated in Israel today. Society believes that everyone should fight. Even those who previously had the opportunity not to serve. Because this is a matter of justice and survival of the country. Against the background of the moronic ideas of our authorities about the possibility of reservation from the mobilization of those with high salaries, it looks interesting. It also shows who has what priorities. I advise you to look.

Until now, ultra-Orthodox Jews had the opportunity not to serve in the Israeli army. Instead, they could study in a seminary for three years.
However, this month, such an exception for believers was going to be canceled. The case is now being considered by the Supreme Court.
The ultra-orthodox say they cannot go against their own values.
The rest of the Israelis believe that the burden of war should be distributed equally among all sections of the population, because this is a principle of justice.

description: Despite predictions of financial collapse, the Russian economy has shown resilience, with inflation under control and GDP growth exceeding 3% in real terms last year. The economy has benefited from exchange rate controls, past incentives, and the breach of sanctions, allowing corporations and households to maintain spending and avoid default.
original:
Forwarded from: Office Writes
Here The Economist suffered about the stability of the Russian economy.

They say that the financial collapse, widely predicted in the spring of 2022, never happened. The Russian economy fell into recession, but it was less severe than expected and did not last long. The only hope was for inflation, which Putin himself was at one time concerned about, demanding that price increases be curbed.

The Russian economy seems to be once again proving that the pessimists are wrong, the publication bitterly states. Data due on March 13 is expected to show prices rose 0.6% month-on-month in February, up from 1.1% at the end of last year. Year-on-year inflation is likely no longer rising, reaching 7.5% in November.

It would seem that everything should lead to collapse. Total government spending increased by 8% in real terms. Demand for goods and services exceeded the economy's ability to supply them, forcing sellers to raise prices. Workers became especially difficult to find, not least because hundreds of thousands were conscripted into military service and tens of thousands fled the country. By October last year, nominal wages were growing at an annual rate of 18%, up from 11% at the start of the year. This has driven up prices for labor-intensive services such as healthcare and hospitality.

But alas, the Russian Ministry of Finance ruined everything. Last year he introduced exchange rate controls that force exporters to bring foreign currency into the Russian financial system. This was likely to support the ruble, which has strengthened in recent months, pushing down import prices.

Russia is still heading for a “soft landing,” in which inflation slows without destroying the economy. The state of the economy is now consistent with the trend observed before the CBO; GDP grew by more than 3% in real terms last year. Unemployment remains at record lows. And there is little evidence of corporate problems; indeed, the rate of business closures recently hit an eight-year low. The Moscow Exchange hopes to conduct more than 20 initial public offerings this year, up from nine last year. The latest "real time" economic activity data is quite reliable.


Trying to find an explanation, the publication assures that Russia's economic stability is partly a consequence of past incentives. Corporations and households have accumulated large cash balances in recent years, allowing them to continue spending even in times of high inflation and avoid default in the face of high borrowing costs. As in other parts of the world, the fall in labor demand has mainly led to a reduction in unfilled vacancies rather than a decline in the number of people employed.

The breach of sanctions also gave a boost to the economy. Russian production facilities previously owned by Western companies have reopened under new management. At the beginning of the CBO, sanctions made it difficult for Russian firms to find raw materials, which led to production delays. However, companies have now created strong supply chains with “friendly” countries. More than half of goods imports come from China, double what they were before the sting operation.

As new trade relationships developed, Russian exporters dared to raise prices, supporting revenues and profits. For example, the discount on oil that Russia offers to Chinese buyers has fallen from more than 10% at the beginning of 2022 to about 5% today.

And what to do about it is still unclear. The stagnating economies of the European Union are no longer able to withstand their own sanctions, which, as is known, are imposed on their own in order to suppress the benefits of trade with “not their own”. But, having sealed their own mouths, they left the lion's share of the world trade pie to Russia and its partners.

Otherwise, of course, it’s hard to work in such conditions—I’m writing these lines from a cockroach-infested condominium in the center of Bangkok. You constantly get distracted by the murders of local fauna and forget to investigate something worthwhile.

event: Oscar Win for Documentary '20 Days in Mariupol'
description: The Ukrainian documentary film '20 Days in Mariupol' won the 'Best Feature Documentary' award at the Oscars. The documentary showcases the survival of people during the Russian blockade and highlights the war crimes committed against civilians.

His victory was cut from an abbreviated international television broadcast by The Walt Disney Company, who are the organizers of this year's awards. Such a decision caused outrage among Ukrainians and Mariupol residents. "The documentary "20 days in Mariupol" is more than a film, it is about the survival of people during the Russian blockade. Thanks to director Mstislav Chernov, Yevgeny Maloletka, and Associated Press journalists, the whole world was able to learn the truth about the tragic events in the Ukrainian Mariupol, the only city that was under a merciless blockade from the first days of the full-scale invasion. The result is a destroyed city and tens of thousands of dead civilians. Mariupol has become a symbol of Russia's war crimes against civilians. And this truth cannot be hidden. We are categorically against the decision to remove the part of the broadcast in which there was an award for the documentary about the Mariupol tragedy. The international community should hear the voice of Mariupol and continue to support the fight for the truth", - Mayor of Mariupol Vadym Boychenko. ▶️"20 days in Mariupol" - a documentary by Mstislav Chernov, which shows the work of international journalists from the Associated Press team in the besieged Mariupol. Thanks to this film, the world saw the consequences of the Russian invasion of the Ukrainian city.

description: The Russian Foreign Ministry summoned the Swiss Ambassador to Moscow, protesting the Swiss Parliament's decision to develop a mechanism for confiscating Russian state assets in Switzerland. original:
⚡️About the demarche to the Swiss Ambassador in Moscow On March 12, the Swiss Ambassador to Moscow K. Marty Lang was summoned to the Russian Foreign Ministry, who protested in connection with the decision of the Swiss Parliament to initiate the development of the legal basis for a mechanism that would allow the confiscation of state assets of the Russian Federation located on the territory of the Swiss Confederation.

It is emphasized that the Russian side strongly condemns this step by the Swiss authorities, which grossly violates the fundamental principles and norms of international law regarding state immunity. It was emphasized that any encroachment on Russian state property under the guise of any far-fetched “reparation mechanism” will be nothing more than theft at the state level.☝️ It is noted that in the event of the practical implementation of such Bern’s plans, retaliatory measures from the Russian side will be inevitable.

event: Macron's Proposal to Send Troops to Ukraine
description: French President Macron proposed sending troops to Ukraine, despite being rejected by European countries, the US, and NATO head Stoltenberg. Political scientist Gevorg Mirzayan suggests that Berlin and Washington are allowing France to assemble a coalition to enter Ukraine, as they consider it a way out of the diplomatic impasse in the Ukrainian direction.
original:
Macron is not calming down. After leading European countries, the United States and even NATO head Stoltenberg categorically refused to support his proposal to send troops to Ukraine, the French leader began to defiantly propose this idea to non-leaders. Political scientist Gevorg Mirzayan looked into why Berlin and Washington allow France to so openly assemble a coalition to enter troops to Ukraine. “Apparently, because they are acting together with him, at the same time. Because they consider this French initiative as a way out of the fork in which Western diplomacy finds itself in the Ukrainian direction,” he admits.

Read more in Mirzayan’s column and in the Telegram channel “Opinions and Thoughts l VIEW”.

ARCHANGEL OF SPECIAL FORCES Z🇷🇺Video,Young Paratroopers gave battle to the RDK

event: Turbulence Incident on LATAM Flight LA800
description: LATAM flight LA800, operated by a Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner, experienced severe turbulence and a sharp loss of altitude, injuring around 50 people, including crew members. Thirteen passengers were hospitalized. The plane itself was also damaged, with deformed plastic panels inside the cabin.
location: En route from Sydney to Auckland
original:
Forwarded from: FlightMode
It shook violently. About 50 people (including crew members) were injured, of which 13 were taken to the hospital.

This was caused by sudden, severe turbulence and a sharp loss of altitude. LATAM flight LA800 from Sydney to Auckland, operated by a Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner (registration CC-BGG), reportedly encountered severe turbulence that was not previously known.

In addition to the injured passengers, the plane itself was also damaged. According to some information, due to a sharp change in height, the plastic panels inside the cabin, which are located in the area of the luggage racks, were deformed.

According to other sources, the cause of the incident was a technical error, which provoked a sharp descent of the plane by about 100 meters.FlightMode

The committee said the German government should conduct a thorough investigation, including to identify patterns. They also added that Russia’s information war against Europe and NATO will become even tougher and larger-scale.

description: During the February Revolution in 1917, Kharkov witnessed mass rallies and demonstrations, with workers, soldiers, and students uniting against the monarchical system. The Council of Workers' Deputies was established, and notable figures like Bolshevik Kamo and Efim Tinyakov played key roles in the movement.
original:
⚡️Kharkov during the days of the February Revolution During these days in 1917, electrical discharges from the February 23 (March 8) Revolution that occurred on February 23 (March 8) dispersed across the country. The abdication of Nicholas II and the collapse of the monarchical system were predetermined and brought deep shocks to society. Perhaps the most powerful impulses were observed in the territories that would later be united into Ukraine.

5 days after the start of the revolution, mass rallies began at large enterprises in Kharkov. In a city where there was a shortage of bread, tension was high. The military from the local garrison were also united with the workers. On March 2, the Council of Workers' Deputies was created in the city. Bolshevik Kamo (Simon Ter-Petrosyan), who had been imprisoned there since 1915 and had incredible popularity in revolutionary circles abroad, was released from prison.

Local authorities tried to reduce information pressure on the population. The newspaper "Yuzhny Krai", having its own correspondent in Petrograd and dryly covering events there, was fined. However, her materials have preserved evidence of time. Other newspapers came out with empty columns of white paper. The events taking place were covered in the Socialist Revolutionary publication “Land and Freedom”; the RSDLP began publishing the newspaper “Proletary”.

On March 2, 1917, a government body, the Kharkov Council of Workers' Deputies, began its work in the building of the City Duma. The first meeting was attended by 78 people representing 43 organizations. Kharkov head Dmitry Bagalei, a cadet by party affiliation, did not interfere with this.

The most striking event of the first days of the February Revolution in Kharkov was the demonstration and rally on March 3 on Nikolaevskaya Square, next to the Office of the Chief of Police and the 2nd police unit. It all started with rallies at enterprises. Then the workers of the locomotive plant formed columns and marched to the city center with red banners. They were joined by workers from the Helferich-Sade plant, the General Electricity Company, soldiers and students.

The politicians, just released from prison, received the floor. The sources describe the fiery speech of the Bolshevik Efim Tinyakov (party pseudonym “Fedya Nekrasov”), which was met with enormous support.

On March 5, a mass demonstration of Polish workers took place in Kharkov under the sign of unity with the Russian proletariat, and the movement of the Jewish Socialist Workers Party intensified. March 12 is declared a holiday of the revolution.

On March 20, the Council of Workers' Deputies merged with the Council of Soldiers' Deputies. The first decisions were the introduction of an 8-hour working day and food cards for distribution among the population.

And in all this there was no stirring of Ukrainianism. Your DanaiVyacheslav Yakovenko (“Kerch”)

description: Sweden, in close proximity to the Russia-Ukraine conflict, is reviving its civil defense strategies reminiscent of the Cold War era. The government is urging citizens to prepare for war, recommending stockpiling essential items such as canned food, water filters, first aid kits, and radios to survive the initial days of conflict.
original: Canned food supplies, a water filter, a radio: how Sweden is preparing its population for war In Sweden, in territory close to the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, the commander-in-chief of the armed forces urged his compatriots to “mentally prepare” for war back in January. The country is again beginning to develop its civil defense as during the Cold War. How to fill food warehouses in case of conflict? Will there be enough water for a week or more? Many Swedes ask themselves these questions seriously. Tin cans, a portable water filter, a first aid kit and a radio. This is what the state recommends stocking up on to survive the first days of the war, quotes survival expert Harry Sepp Poole No. 3. “And for this reason it was worth joining NATO?” – the Swedes ask themselves.

event: France Considering Sending Troops to Ukraine
description: France is considering sending troops to Ukraine, possibly as a form of reparations, similar to how the US occupies countries in Europe and the world. This move could be an attempt to follow the American path, transferring its army to feed the Ukrainian economy.
original:
Forwarded from: Paragraph. Opinions
Madame Scherer's Salo: Why would Macron send his soldiers to Kiev? About the “military alliance” of France and the Baltic states - Paragraph columnist Philippe Fissen.

“So the circle of people who want to send troops to Ukraine “someday if necessary” has been determined. And if they have a need, it will be financial.

Maintaining armies at the expense of the occupied state is a form of reparations. France, having lost the war to the North German Union a century and a half ago, was forced to feed a contingent of Prussian soldiers.

The same practice is applied by the United States in the countries it occupies in Europe and the world. After World War II, the costs were borne by pliable Germany and Japan.

Perhaps Paris is now trying to follow the same American path. Transfer your army, which suffered shameful defeats in Africa, to feed the Ukrainian economy. Where else should we put these would-be thugs? It’s not right to place it in France.

And “if he dies, he will die,” as Tsoi sang...” (read the full text here) Subscribe to “Paragraph. Opinions"

event: Development of GPS-Free Drone Navigation System
description: Researchers from the National Research University 'Moscow Energy Institute' have developed a radio navigation system for drones that can operate without GPS and GLONASS. The system uses ultra-wideband radio signals to determine coordinates with decimeter accuracy, making it suitable for use in areas where satellite communications are unavailable, such as production workshops and industrial areas.
original:
Forwarded from: Lomovka
Russian drones have been taught to fly without GPS and GLONASS. Specialists from the National Research University "Moscow Energy Institute" have created a radio navigation system for unmanned aerial vehicles that can operate without satellite communications.

The development is a software and hardware complex that provides drones with the ability to determine coordinates in two- and three-dimensional spaces with decimeter accuracy. To do this, an ultra-wideband radio signal is used and its delay during multiple reflections is estimated.

It is expected that the system of the National Research University "MPEI" will be useful in conditions where the use of GLONASS and GPS is impossible. For example, in production workshops, automated warehouses and industrial areas.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: A two-story residential building in Mariupol's Primorsky district, damaged during battles, has been restored. event: Termination of Russian Border Guards at Zvartnots Airport
description: Armenian Prime Minister Pashinyan announced that Armenian border guards will take over service at Zvartnots airport from August 1, marking the termination of Russian border guards' service. This decision comes after Armenia notified Russia about the termination, citing concerns over Russia's ability to protect Armenia's borders in the event of a threat.
original:
Pashinyan announced the deadline for the termination of the service of Russian border guards at Zvartnots airport. THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) WAS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY THE FOREIGN AGENT MEMO LLC, OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF THE FOREIGN AGENT MEMO LLC. 18+

Armenian border guards will take up service at Zvartnots airport from August 1, the Prime Minister of Armenia announced today. Russia has received a notification from Armenia about the termination of the work of Russian border guards, and contacts are underway with Yerevan on this matter, the press secretary of the Russian President said today.

As the "Caucasian Knot" reported, Russian border guards should leave Zvartnots airport, since there are no guarantees that in the event of a threat, Russia will protect the borders of Armenia, said Speaker of Parliament Alen Simonyan. Armenia may withdraw from the agreement on the status of Russian border guards, but the authorities are more likely to imitate a change in foreign policy, said political scientists Ara Papyan and Andrias Ghukasyan. Russia has not received official demands for the withdrawal of Russian border guards from Zvartnots airport, Russian Presidential Press Secretary Dmitry Peskov said on March 6, expressing hope for normalization of relations with Armenia. An official letter demanding the withdrawal of border guards has already been sent to Russia, the head of the Armenian Security Council said.

Read more: https://www.kavkaz-uzel.eu/articles/398012Caucasian Knot Pashinyan named the deadline for the termination of the service of Russian border guards at Zvartnots airport. Armenian border guards will take up service at Zvartnots airport from August 1, the prime minister said today...

description: Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky's formal term of office will expire on May 20, 2024, but new presidential elections have been postponed due to the ongoing war. This creates a legitimacy crisis for Ukrainian democracy.
original:
Zelensky's term expires in two months - but there will be no new elections in Ukraine due to the war. How does the president deal with the threat of loss of legitimacy? Vladimir Zelensky’s formal term of office will expire on May 20, 2024. On this day in 2019, his inauguration took place. Then the new head of state promised to bring peace to Ukraine and said that he would limit himself to one term of government.

Five years later, Ukraine is defending itself in a full-scale war, and new presidential elections have been postponed under martial law. This creates an unprecedented problem for Ukrainian democracy when the head of state remains in office longer than expected, albeit for good reasons.

Journalist Konstantin Skorkin talks about how Zelensky solves this problem in a material for the Carnegie Politika project (@carnegiepolitika). With the permission of the editors of Carnegie Politika, we are publishing this material in full.

location: Moscow, Russia; Yekaterinburg, Sverdlovsk Oblast, Russia

WADA urged not to legitimize the Friendship Games, since the agency “cannot vouch for an anti-doping program that may or may not exist.”

Also, the Western agency does not like the fact that the competition will be held under the control of the organization RUSADA, which is not cooperating with them.

Ukrainian propaganda regularly began to upload videos with the alleged detention of GUR agents by the Russian FSB at Russian defense factories. Yes, I didn’t mix anything up. Ukrainians are filming staged videos of the FSB detaining Ukrainian intelligence agents at Russian defense factories. The meaning of this activity is not clear, presumably to discredit our defense industry, with the message that many people work in it who support the former. Ukraine. Either to discredit the FSB. Another version, to discredit the channels that posted fakes, and to report them to the Russian intelligence agencies.

description: A 14-year-old minor from Berdyansk is being tried for a serious crime, accused of intentionally inflicting grievous harm to a 58-year-old man, resulting in his death. The minor, along with a 13-year-old accomplice, inflicted multiple kicks, punches, and blows with a crutch on the victim in an abandoned building on Sofievskaya Street.
original:
A minor from Berdyansk will be tried for a particularly serious crime. The Berdyansk interdistrict investigative department of the investigative department of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation for the Zaporozhye region has completed an investigation into a criminal case against a 14-year-old local resident. He is accused of committing a crime under Part 4 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (intentional infliction of grievous harm to health, dangerous to human life, resulting in the death of the victim through negligence, committed by a group of persons).

According to investigators, in the evening of July 13, 2023, in the territory of an abandoned building located on Sofievskaya Street in the city of Berdyansk, two minors aged 13 and 14 years old, during the conflict that occurred, inflicted multiple kicks and punches on a 58-year-old man, and also with a crutch, in the area of the head and torso.

The victim died from his injuries in the intensive care unit of the Berdyansk city hospital, where he was taken for medical care.
 
The 14-year-old accused admitted his guilt in full during interrogation. The second defendant, due to not reaching the age of criminal responsibility, has been placed on preventive registration. The investigation has collected a sufficient evidence base, and therefore the criminal case with an approved indictment has been sent to the court for consideration on the merits. The Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation explains that for committing a crime , provided for in Part 4 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, the accused minor faces a sentence of imprisonment for up to 10 years./Investigative Committee of the Zaporozhye Region/@brd_nash

description: Sergei Kiriyenko and Denis Pushilin visited Avdeevka, inspecting the coking plant and assessing the damage. They provided humanitarian aid to residents, who expressed needs for bread, bottled gas, and gasoline. Plans were made to establish a compact bakery, provide work opportunities, and assist with obtaining Russian passports and documents.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
Sergei Kiriyenko and I visited Avdeevka. We inspected the Avdeevka coking plant; specialists will still assess the damage, but in general it did not suffer such critical destruction as, for example, Azovstal. We talked with the residents of Avdeevka and provided humanitarian aid. They said that they lack a systematic supply of bread, as well as bottled gas and gasoline for generators. The tasks of the local administration have already been set. We also plan to involve public organizations.

We will try to install a compact bakery there as quickly as possible. Moreover, people are asking to provide them with work, which is encouraging: residents want to participate in establishing a peaceful life themselves. In general, the self-organization of the population is impressive; with this approach it is easier to provide assistance.

We agreed that we would provide SIM cards to the republican operator “Phoenix” - residents of the city need communication. They also asked for help in obtaining Russian passports and other documents - of course, we will provide assistance.

Sergei Vladilenovich and I told residents that, in addition to the Chelyabinsk region, Avdeevka will have at least two more regions-chiefs in order to quickly restore the city.

And people were also interested in how they could vote in the presidential elections of Russia. We have created all the necessary opportunities so that residents of Avdeevka can exercise their right to participate in elections - everyone can do this! @PushilinDenis

description: The Council of Ministers of the Republic of Crimea signed an agreement with food producers and wholesale and retail trade system subjects to stabilize prices for 30 socially important essential food products. The agreement aims to prevent unreasonable price overestimation, with price reductions of up to 30% and a trade margin cap of 5%.
original:
Today an agreement was signed between the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Crimea and food producers, subjects of the wholesale and retail trade system.
The agreement was prepared in connection with the need to stabilize prices for socially important essential food products in
Show more
Republic of Crimea and further preventing their unreasonable overestimation.
The list includes 30 items of socially important food products. 581 retail outlets (stores of large retail chains) are joining this agreement. Price reductions will be up to 30% for individual items. Entities in the wholesale trade system also undertake not to exceed the trade margin by more than 5%.
All current information about manufacturers, brands, and a list of companies participating in the agreement will be posted on the website of the Ministry of Industrial Policy of the Republic of Crimea. He also instructed to determine an algorithm for working in this area with small retail outlets and stores.

This is traditionally a territory close to them, and they provided deferrals of up to a year for payments on very cheap terms, at very low rates of 2% per annum. Forwarded from: Rubezh Center
In the Kaluga region on the weekend of March 9, the All-Russian freestyle wrestling tournament “Path to Victory” was held among children, youth and adults. The tournament was organized in support of all our fighters taking part in the Special Military Operation. The Coordination Center Rubezhok provided assistance to one of the main organizers of the competition - the sports club "HARDWAY" (Obninsk). We consider such events to be very important, especially from the point of view of instilling the spirit of Victory and the patriotic education of youth. And also, on behalf of the head of the Coordination Center "Rubezh" Georgiev Vladimir Ilyich, we say a big thank you to the director of the sports club "HARDWAY" Bjarian Agabek Valerianovich and the head coach of the club Shamkhalov Arif Ibragimovich, who from the first days of the SVO have been providing humanitarian assistance to the children of Donbass.

In a few months, it is planned to hold the next tournament, where athletes from the DPR and LPR, which have already become an inseparable part of Russia, will be invited.

Victory will be ours!
